title: Newtons second law - acceleration of three blocks

content.question: Three blocks are in contact with each other, and they are at rest on a horizontal surface with negligible friction. The masses of the blocks are <math alttext="2 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mtext> kg</mtext></math>, <math alttext="4 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mtext> kg</mtext></math>, and <math alttext="1 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mtext> kg</mtext></math>, as shown in the figure. While a force of <math alttext="28 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>28</mn><mtext> N</mtext></math> pushes the <math alttext="2 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mtext> kg</mtext></math> block to the right, what is the magnitude of the force that the <math alttext="2 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mtext> kg</mtext></math> block exerts on the <math alttext="4 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mtext> kg</mtext></math> block?

choices.label: <math alttext="8 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.4em"></mspace><mn>8</mn><mtext> N</mtext></math>
